intro: Spiradiclis caespitosa f. cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical spiradiclis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, cylindrical growth habit and is native to specific regions in southern Africa. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
